website_summaries.verdict: A unique 3DS game that allows kids and adults to be more creative with level design and storytelling.
pros: Custom made courses provide a different, unique gameplay experience with most playthroughs
The creation interface is easy to pick up for most beginning players and aspiring level designers
cons: Level development is more time consuming than playing classic levels and challenges

customer_reviews.title: Overall I think this is a great game. However
customer_reviews.text: Just beat the last world in the Mario challenge to unlock all the items! Overall I think this is a great game. However, not all of the perks are there like the Wii U version. Pros: *You have to play through levels to unlock items. *Levels have added challenges for extra difficulty but are not required. However completing challenges unlocks more worlds. *You can download and play levels created from the Wii U version Cons: *You can't use amiibos *You can't upload your own levels via internet, instead you have to use street pass or download with friends who have the game. Overall it gives you endless mario levels to explore and create. Glad Nintendo made this for the 3DS
customer_reviews.author: The Physics Guy

customer_reviews.title: Brings out the talent in your child.
customer_reviews.text: My child is so happy with this game. He just turned 7 and is able to build his own worlds. He went through the tutorials on his own with very little frustration. You definitely need the stylus for this game when creating.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Could be a good Addition to Nintendo 3ds Players 16 and Up for Maximum video game enjoyment! -A bit technical for younger player
customer_reviews.text: Wow!..you can get extra creative with this Mario levels builder.Will be okay for kids ages 6 to 10,Great!,For kids ages 16 and up,can make for some:interesting,tricky,and "Mario-worthy" Level building! -"Try to be as tricky as possible!" Some regular Levels for some regular play to earn additional accessories to Level building. Includes levels from: Super Mario Bros.,Super Mario Bros.3,Super Mario world,Super Mario Bros. From Nintendo wii..for some play and Level building.
customer_reviews.author: david vargas

customer_reviews.title: Very fun Game
customer_reviews.text: Im 30 yrs old and im addicted to this game its fun and challenging at the same time love the idea of playing peoples levels online
customer_reviews.author: Tigrito818

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable if you don't have a WiiU
customer_reviews.text: The lack of options this game gives you when compared to the WiiU version is a little frustrating, so you really have to get creative. All the flaws found in a typical Mario game (such as the temperamental jumping) are present in this game, but you can edit the stages you create at any time to match your levels of skill and control. You can also download levels that other people have played using their 3DSs or WiiUs and modify them to your liking.
customer_reviews.author: JoeMavro

customer_reviews.title: Game
customer_reviews.text: (((They))) market this to make you think you can upload and share it to the gaming community. I thought I did enough research. No. (((They))) scrubbed the internet enough to make you think you can create and share your levels. But no. You can't. Still worth it. 5 stars. No time to create anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Where are all the features?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game expecting it to be almost the same as the Wii U version. Unfortunately, many of the sounds effects, online functions, Amiibo functions, and more are missing. Despite this, Super Mario Maker is still a pretty good game. The game offers more than just building courses. You can also play challenge courses, share via streetpass, and play select courses from the Wii U edition. This offers the opportunity for hours of Super Mario fun and frustration, especially when you get another one of those "don't move" courses. Pros: Make your own levels Play lots of pre-made and online courses Cons: Stripped online functionality Lack of costumes, Amiibo No diagonal ground Boredom ensures when creating levels
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: So much fun. Can't upload levels.
customer_reviews.text: Very fun. I've wanted Nintendo to out with a game like this for a long time. And they finally did it. Use items from Super Mario 1 and 3 and Super Mario World and more. You can't upload your levels or pick specific online levels though like you can with the Wii U version :-(
customer_reviews.author: Jacob J. Persico

customer_reviews.title: It’sa me, Luigi!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the kind of game that I’ll spend 5 full days of design-time on, building a singular level that I’ll then play through for a span of 5 minutes, only to jump immediately back into the design aspect of it again. It’s a creators playground. Can’t wait for 2!

Seems a little tedious at times, some of the other player maps are impossible and only shared and designed to frustrate IMO but there are some good ones. I play my maps the most though.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Made the Cut, but Falls Short on Level-Sharing Promise
customer_reviews.text: While it's a useful spinoff from the Wii U version by the same name, Mario Maker on 3DS feels limited in its scope. I bought it to play those awesome user-generated levels that I've seen on YouTube. While there's a smattering of those here, the ability to share levels feels much less robust than its console counterpart.

product_meta.title: Super Mario Maker for Nintendo 3DS - Nintendo 3DS
product_meta.description: Get ready to play a near-infinite number of side-scrolling 2D Mario courses anytime, anywhere! Earn in-game medals in 100 built-in courses and access recommended courses from the Super Mario Maker game on the Wii U console. Plus, design courses and share them with other players via the StreetPass feature and local wireless! Not all levels created in Super Mario Maker for the Wii U console are compatible with this release. Wireless Internet access required in order to access the Wii U version's courses. For more info, go to support.nintendo.com. This game does not include an online-upload feature. Game in 2D.
feature_bullets: Want your cannons to shoot coins? Go for it! In this game, you call the shots, and simple touch-screen controls and interactive tutorials make designing courses a snap.
Learn design tips and tricks from Mary O. and Yamamura, then share your masterpieces via the StreetPass feature and local wireless.
Collaborating has never been easier now that you can share incomplete courses with other players.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars666 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
